articles.title: Frases Essenciais em Alemao para Casais
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Aprender alemao junto com seu parceiro abre portas para uma comunicacao mais profunda e experiencias unicas nos paises de lingua alema. Este guia traz as frases essenciais que todo casal precisa dominar.

## Frases de Amor e Carinho

<VocabCard
  word="Ich liebe dich"
  translation="Eu te amo"
  pronunciation="[ich LEE-be dich]"
  example="Ich liebe dich mehr als alles andere."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ich hab dich lieb"
  translation="Gosto muito de voce / Te adoro"
  pronunciation="[ich hap dich LEEP]"
  example="Schlaf gut, ich hab dich lieb!"
/>

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Du bedeutest mir alles"
  translation="Voce significa tudo para mim"
  pronunciation="[du be-DOI-test mir A-les]"
  context="Uma declaracao de amor profundo"
/>

<CultureTip title="Ich liebe dich vs. Ich hab dich lieb" flag="üá©üá™">
"Ich liebe dich" e reservado para amor romantico profundo. "Ich hab dich lieb" e mais leve, usado entre familiares, amigos proximos ou no inicio de um relacionamento. Escolha com cuidado!
</CultureTip>

## Frases para o Dia a Dia

<VocabCard
  word="Guten Morgen, mein Schatz"
  translation="Bom dia, meu amor"
  pronunciation="[GU-ten MOR-gen main SHATS]"
  example="Guten Morgen, mein Schatz! Hast du gut geschlafen?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wie war dein Tag?"
  translation="Como foi seu dia?"
  pronunciation="[vi var dain TAK]"
  example="Hallo Liebling! Wie war dein Tag?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ich vermisse dich"
  translation="Sinto sua falta"
  pronunciation="[ich fer-MI-se dich]"
  example="Wenn du auf Reisen bist, vermisse ich dich sehr."
/>

## Fazendo Planos Juntos

<VocabCard
  word="Was mochtest du heute machen?"
  translation="O que voce gostaria de fazer hoje?"
  pronunciation="[vas MOCH-test du HOI-te MA-chen]"
  example="Es ist Samstag! Was mochtest du heute machen?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Lass uns ausgehen"
  translation="Vamos sair"
  pronunciation="[las uns AUS-ge-en]"
  example="Lass uns heute Abend ausgehen!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ich habe eine Uberraschung fur dich"
  translation="Tenho uma surpresa para voce"
  pronunciation="[ich HA-be AI-ne u-ber-RA-shung fur dich]"
  example="Schatz, ich habe eine Uberraschung fur dich!"
/>

## O Verbo "Mochten" - Gostar/Querer

<ConjugationTable
  verb="mochten"
  meaning="gostar de / querer (educado)"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "ich", "word": "mochte", "translation": "eu gostaria" },
    { "person": "du", "word": "mochtest", "translation": "tu gostarias" },
    { "person": "er/sie/es", "word": "mochte", "translation": "ele/ela gostaria" },
    { "person": "wir", "word": "mochten", "translation": "nos gostariamos" },
    { "person": "ihr", "word": "mochtet", "translation": "voces gostariam" },
    { "person": "sie/Sie", "word": "mochten", "translation": "eles gostariam" }
  ]}
/>

## Expressoes de Apoio

<VocabCard
  word="Ich bin fur dich da"
  translation="Estou aqui para voce"
  pronunciation="[ich bin fur dich DA]"
  example="Egal was passiert, ich bin fur dich da."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Alles wird gut"
  translation="Tudo vai ficar bem"
  pronunciation="[A-les virt GUT]"
  example="Mach dir keine Sorgen, alles wird gut."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ich bin stolz auf dich"
  translation="Estou orgulhoso(a) de voce"
  pronunciation="[ich bin SHTOLTS auf dich]"
  example="Du hast es geschafft! Ich bin so stolz auf dich!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Expressando Emocoes" flag="üá©üá™">
Os alemaes podem parecer reservados, mas valorizam muito expressoes sinceras de apoio. Dizer "Ich bin stolz auf dich" (estou orgulhoso de voce) tem muito peso emocional.
</CultureTip>

## Pedindo Desculpas

<VocabCard
  word="Es tut mir leid"
  translation="Me desculpe / Sinto muito"
  pronunciation="[es TUT mir LAIT]"
  example="Es tut mir leid, ich war ungerecht."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Verzeih mir"
  translation="Me perdoe"
  pronunciation="[fer-TSAI mir]"
  example="Ich war dumm. Bitte, verzeih mir."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Konnen wir daruber reden?"
  translation="Podemos conversar sobre isso?"
  pronunciation="[KO-nen vir da-RU-ber RE-den]"
  example="Ich weiss, du bist sauer. Konnen wir daruber reden?"
/>

## Frases Romanticas Especiais

<VocabCard
  word="Du machst mich glucklich"
  translation="Voce me faz feliz"
  pronunciation="[du MACHST mich GLUK-lich]"
  example="Jeden Tag mit dir - du machst mich so glucklich."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ich mochte den Rest meines Lebens mit dir verbringen"
  translation="Quero passar o resto da minha vida com voce"
  pronunciation="[ich MOCH-te den REST MAI-nes LE-bens mit dir fer-BRIN-gen]"
  example="Willst du mich heiraten? Ich mochte den Rest meines Lebens mit dir verbringen."
/>

## Pratica Diaria para Casais

### Manha
- "Guten Morgen, Schatz!"
- "Hast du gut geschlafen?"
- "Ich liebe dich!"

### Durante o Dia
- Enviem mensagens: "Ich denke an dich"
- Perguntem sobre o dia: "Wie lauft es?"

### Noite
- "Wie war dein Tag?"
- "Ich bin froh, dass du da bist"
- "Gute Nacht, ich hab dich lieb"

<CTA text="Prontos para dominar o alemao juntos?" buttonText="Continue Aprendendo" />

articles.title: French Forgiveness Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Forgiveness‚Äî"le pardon"‚Äîis essential for lasting love. When you're with a French speaker, knowing how to ask for and grant forgiveness in their language makes healing more meaningful. Here are essential French phrases.

## Asking for Forgiveness

### Pardonne-moi
**Pronunciation:** par-DOHN-mwah

**Meaning:** "Forgive me"

**When to use it:** A direct, heartfelt request for forgiveness.

### Je te demande pardon
**Pronunciation:** zhuh tuh duh-MAHND par-DOHN

**Meaning:** "I ask for your forgiveness"

**When to use it:** A formal, sincere request.

### Peux-tu me pardonner?
**Pronunciation:** puh-too muh par-doh-NAY

**Meaning:** "Can you forgive me?"

**When to use it:** When asking if forgiveness is possible.

### Je sais que je t'ai fait du mal et j'en suis profond√©ment d√©sol√©(e)
**Pronunciation:** zhuh seh kuh zhuh tay fay doo mahl ay zhahn swee proh-fohn-day-MAHN day-zoh-LAY

**Meaning:** "I know I hurt you and I'm deeply sorry"

**When to use it:** When acknowledging pain caused.

### Je n'ai aucune excuse
**Pronunciation:** zhuh nay oh-KOON eks-KOOZ

**Meaning:** "I have no excuse"

**When to use it:** When taking full responsibility.

## Expressing Regret

### Je regrette profond√©ment
**Pronunciation:** zhuh ruh-GRET proh-fohn-day-MAHN

**Meaning:** "I deeply regret it"

**When to use it:** To express deep remorse.

### Si je pouvais revenir en arri√®re, je ferais autrement
**Pronunciation:** see zhuh poo-VAY ruh-vuh-NEER ahn ah-RYAIR, zhuh fuh-RAY oh-truh-MAHN

**Meaning:** "If I could go back, I would do it differently"

**When to use it:** To express what you wish you had done.

### Je n'ai jamais voulu te faire du mal
**Pronunciation:** zhuh nay zhah-MAY voo-LOO tuh fair doo mahl

**Meaning:** "I never meant to hurt you"

**When to use it:** When the harm was unintentional.

## Granting Forgiveness

### Je te pardonne
**Pronunciation:** zhuh tuh par-DOHN

**Meaning:** "I forgive you"

**When to use it:** To grant forgiveness directly.

### Je ne t'en veux pas
**Pronunciation:** zhuh nuh tahn vuh pah

**Meaning:** "I don't hold it against you"

**When to use it:** To indicate you're not resentful.

### C'est oubli√©
**Pronunciation:** say oo-blee-AY

**Meaning:** "It's forgotten"

**When to use it:** To indicate you're moving past it.

### On fait tous des erreurs
**Pronunciation:** ohn fay too day zeh-RUR

**Meaning:** "We all make mistakes"

**When to use it:** To show understanding.

## Processing Forgiveness

### J'ai besoin de temps pour pardonner
**Pronunciation:** zhay buh-ZWAHN duh tahn poor par-doh-NAY

**Meaning:** "I need time to forgive"

**When to use it:** When you're not ready yet.

### Je veux te pardonner, mais j'ai besoin de temps
**Pronunciation:** zhuh vuh tuh par-doh-NAY, may zhay buh-ZWAHN duh tahn

**Meaning:** "I want to forgive you, but I need time"

**When to use it:** When working toward forgiveness.

## Moving Forward

### Comment pouvons-nous avancer?
**Pronunciation:** koh-MAHN poo-VOHN-noo ah-vahn-SAY

**Meaning:** "How can we move forward?"

**When to use it:** To focus on the future.

### Je veux qu'on surmonte √ßa ensemble
**Pronunciation:** zhuh vuh kohn soor-MOHNT sah ahn-SAHM-bluh

**Meaning:** "I want us to overcome this together"

**When to use it:** To commit to healing together.

## Cultural Notes

In French culture, sincere apologies are valued. The phrase "demander pardon" (to ask forgiveness) shows humility and emotional maturity.

Physical affection often accompanies forgiveness‚Äîembraces and closeness help restore intimacy.

## The Path to Healing

"Le pardon lib√®re le c≈ìur" (Forgiveness frees the heart). These phrases help you find your way back to love.

articles.title: 50+ Turkish Pet Names and Endearments
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Turkish is a language rich with affectionate expressions. Whether you're dating someone Turkish or want to add sweetness to your relationship, learning Turkish pet names will bring you closer together. These terms of endearment reveal the warm, romantic heart of Turkish culture.

## The Most Common: Canim

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Canim"
  translation="My soul / My dear"
  pronunciation="JAH-nuhm"
  context="The most versatile and commonly used term of endearment in Turkish, used between partners, friends, and family."
/>

**Canim** literally means "my soul" but is used like "dear" or "honey" in English. It's the go-to term of endearment that every Turkish couple uses daily. You'll hear it constantly in Turkey, and using it with your partner shows you understand Turkish culture.

## Classic Turkish Terms of Endearment

These are the foundational pet names every couple should know:

<VocabCard
  word="Askam"
  translation="My love"
  pronunciation="ahsh-KAHM"
  example="Askam, seni cok ozledim."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hayatim"
  translation="My life"
  pronunciation="hah-YAH-tuhm"
  example="Hayatim, nasilsin bugun?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Birtanem"
  translation="My one and only"
  pronunciation="beer-TAH-nem"
  example="Birtanem, seninle cok mutluyum."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sevgilim"
  translation="My beloved"
  pronunciation="sev-gee-LEEM"
  example="Sevgilim, bu aksam ne yapmak istersin?"
/>

<CultureTip title="The Possessive '-im' Suffix" flag="üáπüá∑">
Notice how Turkish pet names often end in "-im" or "-am"? This is the possessive suffix meaning "my." Adding this suffix to words makes them more intimate and personal. For example, "can" (soul) becomes "canim" (my soul), and "ask" (love) becomes "askam" (my love).
</CultureTip>

## Sweet and Cute Pet Names

Turkish has adorable diminutive forms that make words sound cuter and more affectionate:

<VocabCard
  word="Tatliim"
  translation="My sweetheart / My sweetie"
  pronunciation="taht-LUHM"
  example="Tatliim, sana bir surprizim var."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sekerima"
  translation="My sugar"
  pronunciation="sheh-keh-REEM"
  example="Sekerima, bu aksam disari cikmak ister misin?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Balim"
  translation="My honey"
  pronunciation="BAH-luhm"
  example="Balim, kahvaltiya hazir misin?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Cicegim"
  translation="My flower"
  pronunciation="chee-CHEH-eem"
  example="Cicegim, bugun cok guzel gorunuyorsun."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Gulum"
  translation="My rose"
  pronunciation="gew-LEWM"
  example="Gulum, seni ne kadar sevdigimi biliyorsun."
/>

## Animal-Based Pet Names

Like many languages, Turkish uses adorable animal names as terms of endearment:

<VocabCard
  word="Kusum"
  translation="My bird"
  pronunciation="koo-SHOOM"
  example="Kusum, yanimda oldugun icin cok mutluyum."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Kedicigim"
  translation="My little cat / Kitty"
  pronunciation="keh-dee-JEE-eem"
  example="Kedicigim, gel buraya."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tavsan"
  translation="Bunny"
  pronunciation="tahv-SHAHN"
  example="Benim kucuk tavsanim."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Kuzum"
  translation="My lamb"
  pronunciation="koo-ZOOM"
  example="Kuzum, uzulme, her sey iyi olacak."
/>

<CultureTip title="Cultural Significance of 'Kuzum'" flag="üáπüá∑">
"Kuzum" (my lamb) is especially tender in Turkish culture. Lambs represent innocence and preciousness. Parents often use this for children, and partners use it to express protective, caring love. It's one of the most emotionally tender pet names you can use.
</CultureTip>

## Celestial and Poetic Pet Names

Turkish has beautiful poetic terms inspired by nature and the cosmos:

<VocabCard
  word="Gunesim"
  translation="My sun / My sunshine"
  pronunciation="gew-neh-SHEEM"
  example="Gunesim, hayatimi aydinlatiyorsun."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Yildizim"
  translation="My star"
  pronunciation="yuhl-duh-ZUHM"
  example="Yildizim, sen benim icin parliyorsun."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Ayim"
  translation="My moon"
  pronunciation="AH-yuhm"
  example="Ayim, bu gece cok guzel."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Melegim"
  translation="My angel"
  pronunciation="meh-leh-EEM"
  example="Melegim, seni tanidiƒüim icin cok ansliyim."
/>

## Playful and Fun Pet Names

For lighter moments, Turkish offers playful options:

<VocabCard
  word="Bebisim"
  translation="My baby"
  pronunciation="beh-bee-SEEM"
  example="Bebisim, gel film izleyelim."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tontisim"
  translation="My chubby one (affectionate)"
  pronunciation="ton-tee-SHEEM"
  example="Tontisim, seni kucaklamak istiyorum."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Pipisim"
  translation="My little one (playful)"
  pronunciation="pee-pee-SHEEM"
  example="Pipisim, ne kadar tatlisin."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Afacam"
  translation="My naughty one"
  pronunciation="ah-FAH-jahm"
  example="Afacanim, ne yapiyorsun orada?"
/>

## Intensifiers and Variations

Make your pet names even more affectionate with these patterns:

<VocabCard
  word="Biricik askam"
  translation="My one and only love"
  pronunciation="bee-ree-JEEK ahsh-KAHM"
  example="Biricik askam, seninle sonsuza kadar olmak istiyorum."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Canim cicegim"
  translation="My dear flower"
  pronunciation="JAH-nuhm chee-CHEH-eem"
  example="Canim cicegim, sana hediye aldim."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tatli kusum"
  translation="My sweet bird"
  pronunciation="TAHT-luh koo-SHOOM"
  example="Tatli kusum, nasilsin?"
/>

## Regional and Traditional Terms

Some terms have deep cultural roots in Turkish tradition:

<VocabCard
  word="Yar"
  translation="Beloved / Sweetheart (poetic)"
  pronunciation="yahr"
  example="Yarim, seni bekledim uzun yillar."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Gonlumun sultani"
  translation="Sultan of my heart"
  pronunciation="gohn-lew-MEWN sul-TAH-nuh"
  example="Sen gonlumun sultanisin."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Cigerim"
  translation="My liver (meaning: my everything)"
  pronunciation="jee-eh-REEM"
  example="Cigerim, senin icin her seyi yaparim."
/>

<CultureTip title="Why 'My Liver'?" flag="üáπüá∑">
"Cigerim" (my liver) might sound strange to English speakers, but in Turkish culture, the liver is considered the seat of deep emotions and life essence. Calling someone "cigerim" is extremely intimate, expressing that they are essential to your existence. It's similar to saying "you are my heart and soul."
</CultureTip>

## Pet Names by Situation

### Morning Greetings
| Turkish | English | Pronunciation |
|---------|---------|---------------|
| Gunaydin canim | Good morning, dear | gew-NAY-duhn JAH-nuhm |
| Gunaydin hayatim | Good morning, my life | gew-NAY-duhn hah-YAH-tuhm |
| Gunaydin guzelim | Good morning, beautiful | gew-NAY-duhn gew-zeh-LEEM |

### Goodnight Wishes
| Turkish | English | Pronunciation |
|---------|---------|---------------|
| Iyi geceler askam | Good night, my love | ee-YEE geh-jeh-LER ahsh-KAHM |
| Tatli ruyalar tatliim | Sweet dreams, sweetie | TAHT-luh roo-YAH-lahr taht-LUHM |

### When Missing Someone
| Turkish | English | Pronunciation |
|---------|---------|---------------|
| Seni ozledim canim | I missed you, dear | SEH-nee ohz-leh-DEEM JAH-nuhm |
| Yanimda ol hayatim | Be with me, my life | yah-nuhm-DAH ol hah-YAH-tuhm |

## Complete Pet Name Reference

| Turkish | Literal Meaning | Used As | Formality |
|---------|-----------------|---------|-----------|
| Canim | My soul | Dear/Honey | Everyday |
| Askam | My love | My love | Romantic |
| Hayatim | My life | My life | Very affectionate |
| Birtanem | My one and only | One and only | Deeply romantic |
| Tatliim | My sweet | Sweetie | Casual |
| Sekerima | My sugar | Sugar | Playful |
| Balim | My honey | Honey | Sweet |
| Gunesim | My sun | Sunshine | Poetic |
| Melegim | My angel | Angel | Tender |
| Kuzum | My lamb | Lamb | Very tender |

## Tips for Using Turkish Pet Names

1. **Start simple**: Begin with "canim" since it's universally accepted and easy to pronounce
2. **Listen to your partner**: Notice which terms they use and mirror them
3. **Context matters**: Some terms are more intimate than others
4. **Don't overdo it**: Even in Turkish, using too many pet names can sound insincere
5. **Practice pronunciation**: The Turkish letters have unique sounds

> **Pro tip:** Turkish speakers often combine pet names with possessive suffixes. Once you master the basic terms, you can create combinations like "tatli canim" (my sweet dear) or "guzel askam" (my beautiful love).

<CTA
  text="Ready to master Turkish together?"
  buttonText="Start Learning Now"
/>

articles.title: 30+ Italienske Komplimenter til Din Partner: Romantiske Fraser
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Komplimenter er k√¶rlighedens lille daglige vitamin. Et par velvalgte ord p√• din partners modersm√•l kan forvandle en almindelig dag til noget s√¶rligt. I denne guide finder du over 30 smukke komplimenter p√• italiensk. Kombiner med vores [italienske k√¶lenavne](/learn/da/it/italian-pet-names-and-endearments/) for maksimal romantisk effekt!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="You're beautiful"
  translation="Du er smuk"
  pronunciation="joor byu-ti-ful"
  context="En romantisk kompliment p√• italiensk"
/>

## Komplimenter om Udseende

De klassiske komplimenter der f√•r din partner til at f√∏le sig smuk:

<VocabCard
  word="You're beautiful"
  translation="Du er smuk"
  pronunciation="joor byu-ti-ful"
  example="You look beautiful today."
/>

| Italiensk | Dansk | Udtale | Bruges til |
|---------|-------|--------|------------|
| **You're beautiful** | Du er smuk | joor byu-ti-ful | Kvinder |
| **You're handsome** | Du er flot | joor han-sam | M√¶nd |
| **You're gorgeous** | Du er fantastisk smuk | joor gor-jus | Alle |
| **You're attractive** | Du er tiltr√¶kkende | joor uh-trak-tiv | Alle |
| **You're stunning** | Du er betagende | joor stu-ning | Alle |

### Specifikke Komplimenter

- **You have beautiful eyes** (Du har smukke √∏jne) - "juu hav byu-ti-ful aiz"
- **Your smile is amazing** (Dit smil er fantastisk) - "joor smail iz uh-mei-zing"
- **You look great in that** (Du ser godt ud i det) - "juu luk greit in dat"
- **I love your hair** (Jeg elsker dit h√•r) - "ai lav joor hehr"

<CultureTip flag="üáÆüáπ" title="Komplimentkultur">
Engl√¶ndere kan v√¶re subtile med komplimenter. 'You look nice' er h√∏jt ros!
</CultureTip>

## Komplimenter om Personlighed

Disse komplimenter r√∏rer hjertet endnu dybere:

<VocabCard
  word="You're so kind"
  translation="Du er venlig"
  pronunciation="joor sou kaind"
  example="You're so kind to everyone."
/>

| Italiensk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **You're so kind** | Du er venlig | joor sou kaind |
| **You're smart** | Du er klog | joor smart |
| **You're funny** | Du er sjov | joor fa-ni |
| **You're caring** | Du er omsorgsfuld | joor keh-ring |
| **You're brave** | Du er modig | joor breiv |
| **You're talented** | Du er talentfuld | joor ta-len-ted |

### Dybere Komplimenter

- **You inspire me** (Du inspirerer mig)
- **You make me a better person** (Du g√∏r mig til et bedre menneske)
- **I'm so lucky to have you** (Jeg er s√• heldig at have dig)
- **You're amazing** (Du er fantastisk)

## Romantiske Komplimenter

- **I love everything about you** (Jeg elsker alt ved dig) - "ai lav ev-ri-thing uh-baut juu"
- **You're perfect for me** (Du er perfekt for mig) - "joor pur-fekt for mi"
- **You're my dream** (Du er min dr√∏m) - "joor mai driim"
- **You're my everything** (Du er mit alt) - "joor mai ev-ri-thing"

<CultureTip flag="üáÆüáπ" title="Timing">
Giv komplimenter spontant for st√∏rst effekt.
</CultureTip>

## Hverdagskomplimenter

<VocabCard
  word="Your cooking is amazing"
  translation="Din mad smager fantastisk"
  pronunciation="joor ku-king iz uh-mei-zing"
  example="Your cooking is always so good!"
/>

| Situation | Italiensk | Dansk |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| Madlavning | **Your cooking is amazing** | Din mad smager fantastisk |
| Arbejde | **You work so hard** | Du arbejder s√• h√•rdt |
| Hj√¶lp | **You're so helpful** | Du er s√• hj√¶lpsom |
| Humor | **You always make me laugh** | Du f√•r mig altid til at grine |

## Komplimenter til Specielle Lejligheder

### Til en Date
- **You look amazing tonight** (Du ser fantastisk ud i aften)
